timeline.message: CAMEL-15585 - Move variable declaring on top of the method.

timeline.body: I think `orElseGet(Supplier)` can be replaced by `orElse(fallbackConfiguration)` since the `fallbackConfiguration` does not need to be computed
timeline.bodyText: I think orElseGet(Supplier) can be replaced by orElse(fallbackConfiguration) since the fallbackConfiguration does not need to be computed
timeline.bodyHTML: I think orElseGet(Supplier) can be replaced by orElse(fallbackConfiguration) since the fallbackConfiguration does not need to be computed
timeline.author: lburgazzoli

timeline.body: I's been long time since I've worked on this but I think the `else` should be preserved as if `status.isStarted()` returns true, there's no point to check also `status.isStopped()`
timeline.bodyText: I's been long time since I've worked on this but I think the else should be preserved as if status.isStarted() returns true, there's no point to check also status.isStopped()
timeline.bodyHTML: I's been long time since I've worked on this but I think the else should be preserved as if status.isStarted() returns true, there's no point to check also status.isStopped()
timeline.author: lburgazzoli

replies.bodyText: Okay, will revert that to previous state. Thanks @lburgazzoli :)
replies.author: djoleB

replies.bodyText: I don't think it effectively changes the result in this case but an if else makes it clear that it is either started or stopped whereas a list of is could be confusing like can the status be started and stopped at the same time ?
replies.author: lburgazzoli

replies.bodyText: Yes, i agree. Thank for clarifying. :)
replies.author: djoleB

timeline.author: lburgazzoli

timeline.message: CAMEL-15585 - rever some changes. Use .orElse() instead .orElseGet() in stream.
